content:
ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection Class

In this Article

Represents the collection of checked items in a list view control.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.ListBindable(false)]
public class ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection : System.Collections.IList

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

A ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection stores the checked items in a ListView control. Items can only be checked if the CheckBoxes property of the ListView control is set to true. The items stored in the ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection are items contained in the ListView+ListViewItemCollection. The ListView+ListViewItemCollection class stores all items displayed in the ListView control.

The following table shows an example of how the ListView+ListViewItemCollection stores the items of the ListView as well as their selection states in an example ListView control.

Index Item Checked state in the ListView
0 Item1 Unchecked
1 Item2 Checked
2 Item3 Unchecked
3 Item4 Checked
4 Item5 Checked

Based on the ListView+ListViewItemCollection example in the previous table, the following table demonstrates how the ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection would appear.

Index Checked item in ListViewItemCollection
0 Item2
1 Item4
2 Item5

You can use the properties and methods of this class to perform a variety of tasks with the collection. The Contains method enables you to determine whether an item from the ListView+ListViewItemCollection class is a member of the ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection. Once you know that the item is in the collection, you can use the IndexOf method to determine the position of the item in the ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.

Constructors summary

ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection(ListView)

Initializes a new instance of the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection class.

Properties summary

Count

Gets the number of items in the collection.
IsReadOnly

Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
Item(Int32)

Gets the item at the specified index within the collection.
Item(String)

Gets an item with the specified key within the collection.

Methods summary

Contains(ListViewItem)

Determines whether the specified item is located in the collection.
ContainsKey(String)

Determines if a column with the specified key is contained in the collection.
CopyTo(Array,Int32)

Copies the entire collection into an existing array at a specified location within the array.
GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the checked item collection.
IndexOf(ListViewItem)

Returns the index within the collection of the specified item.
IndexOfKey(String)

Determines the index for an item with the specified key.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

ICollection.IsSynchronized

Gets a value indicating whether access to the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection is synchronized (thread safe).
ICollection.SyncRoot

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection of controls.
IList.Add(Object)

Adds an item to the collection.
IList.Clear()

Removes all items from the collection.
IList.Contains(Object)

Verifies whether the item is checked.
IList.IndexOf(Object)

Returns the index within the collection of the specified item.
IList.Insert(Int32,Object)

Inserts an item into the collection at a specified index.
IList.IsFixedSize

Gets a value indicating whether the collection has a fixed size.
IList.Item(Int32)

Gets or sets an object from the collection.
IList.Remove(Object)

Removes the first occurrence of an item from the collection.
IList.RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes an item from the collection at the specified index.

Constructors

  • ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection(ListView)

    Initializes a new instance of the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection class.

    public CheckedListViewItemCollection (System.Windows.Forms.ListView owner);

    Parameters

    • owner
      ListView

      The ListView control that owns the collection.

    Remarks

    You cannot create an instance of this class without associating it with a ListView control.

Properties

  • Count

    Gets the number of items in the collection.

    public int Count { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of items in the collection.

    Remarks

    This property enables you to determine the number of checked items in the ListView control. You can then use this value when looping through the values of the collection and you need to provide a number of iterations to perform the loop.

  • IsReadOnly

    Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.

    public bool IsReadOnly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the collection is read-only; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property is always true for this collection. The items in the collection can only be modified by the ListView control.

  • Item(Int32)

    Gets the item at the specified index within the collection.

    public System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem this[int index] { get; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index of the item in the collection to retrieve.

    Property Value

    • ListViewItem

      A ListViewItem representing the item located at the specified index within the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The index parameter is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.Count* property of ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ListView is in virtual mode.

    Remarks

    This indexer enables you to get a specific item from the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection. The item stored in this collection is an item in the ListView+ListViewItemCollection of the ListView that represents a checked item in the ListView.

  • Item(String)

    Gets an item with the specified key within the collection.

    public virtual System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem this[string key] { get; }

    Parameters

    • key
      String

      The key of the item in the collection to retrieve.

    Property Value

    • ListViewItem

      A ListViewItem representing the item with the specified index within the collection.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The owner ListView is in virtual mode.

    Remarks

    Item returns null if the key parameter is null or empty.

    The Name property corresponds to the key for an item in the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection.

Methods

  • Contains(ListViewItem)

    Determines whether the specified item is located in the collection.

    public bool Contains (System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem item);

    Parameters

    • item
      ListViewItem

      A ListViewItem representing the item to locate in the collection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the specified item is located in the collection; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The Contains method enables you to determine whether an item from the ListView+ListViewItemCollection is a one of the checked items stored in the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection. Once you know that an item is in the checked item collection, you can use the IndexOf method to determine the position of the item in the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection.

  • ContainsKey(String)

    Determines if a column with the specified key is contained in the collection.

    public virtual bool ContainsKey (string key);

    Parameters

    • key
      String

      The name of the item to search for.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if an item with the specified key is contained in the collection; otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The owner ListView is in virtual mode.

    Remarks

    The Name property of a ListViewItem corresponds to the key for an item in the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection.

  • CopyTo(Array,Int32)

    Copies the entire collection into an existing array at a specified location within the array.

    public void CopyTo (Array dest, int index);

    Parameters

    • dest
      Array

      An Array representing the array to copy the contents of the collection to.

    • index
      Int32

      The location within the destination array to copy the items from the collection to.

    Remarks

    You can use this method to combine the checked items from multiple collections into a single array.

  • GetEnumerator()

    Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the checked item collection.

    public System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator ();

    Returns

    • IEnumerator

      An IEnumerator that represents the checked item collection.

  • IndexOf(ListViewItem)

    Returns the index within the collection of the specified item.

    public int IndexOf (System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem item);

    Parameters

    • item
      ListViewItem

      A ListViewItem representing the item to locate in the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The zero-based index of the item in the collection; otherwise, -1.

    Remarks

    Once you know that an item is located within the collection (using the Contains method), you can use the IndexOf method to determine where a specific item within the ListView+ListViewItemCollection for the ListView is stored within the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection.

  • IndexOfKey(String)

    Determines the index for an item with the specified key.

    public virtual int IndexOfKey (string key);

    Parameters

    • key
      String

      The name of the item to retrieve the index for.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The zero-based index for the ListViewItem with the specified name, if found; otherwise, -1.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The owner ListView is in virtual mode.

    Remarks

    The Name property of a ListViewItem corresponds to the key for an item in a ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection.

    The key comparison is not case-sensitive. If the key parameter is null or an empty string, IndexOfKey returns -1.

    If IndexOfKey is called successively, the last returned index will be checked for a key match first, and if there is no match, the search starts at the beginning of the collection.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • ICollection.IsSynchronized

    Gets a value indicating whether access to the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection is synchronized (thread safe).

    bool System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized { get; }

    Returns

    • Boolean

      false in all cases.

  • ICollection.SyncRoot

    Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection of controls.

    object System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot { get; }

    Returns

    • System.Object

      The object used to synchronize the collection.

  • IList.Add(Object)

    Adds an item to the collection.

    int IList.Add (object value);

    Parameters

    • value
      System.Object

      The item to add to the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The zero-based index where value is located in the collection.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      Always thrown.

    Remarks

    You cannot change the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection class directly. To add an item to the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection, use the Checked property.

  • IList.Clear()

    Removes all items from the collection.

    void IList.Clear ();

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      Always thrown.

    Remarks

    You cannot change the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection class directly. To clear the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection, set the Checked property to false for each ListViewItem in the ListView+ListViewItemCollection.

  • IList.Contains(Object)

    Verifies whether the item is checked.

    bool IList.Contains (object item);

    Parameters

    • item
      System.Object

      A ListViewItem to locate in the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if item is found in the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection; otherwise, false.

  • IList.IndexOf(Object)

    Returns the index within the collection of the specified item.

    int IList.IndexOf (object item);

    Parameters

    • item
      System.Object

      A ListViewItem that represents the item to locate in the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The zero-based index of the item if it is in the collection; otherwise, -1.

  • IList.Insert(Int32,Object)

    Inserts an item into the collection at a specified index.

    void IList.Insert (int index, object value);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index at which value should be inserted.

    • value
      System.Object

      The object to be added to the ListView+SelectedIndexCollection.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      Always thrown.

    Remarks

    You cannot change the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection class directly. To add an item to the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection, use the Checked property.

  • IList.IsFixedSize

    Gets a value indicating whether the collection has a fixed size.

    bool System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize { get; }

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true in all cases.

  • IList.Item(Int32)

    Gets or sets an object from the collection.

    object System.Collections.IList.Item[int index] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the element to get or set.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      A ListViewItem that represents the item located at the specified index within the collection.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      This property cannot be set.

  • IList.Remove(Object)

    Removes the first occurrence of an item from the collection.

    void IList.Remove (object value);

    Parameters

    • value
      System.Object

      The object to be removed from the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      Always thrown.

    Remarks

    You cannot change the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection class directly. To remove an item from the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection, use the Checked property.

  • IList.RemoveAt(Int32)

    Removes an item from the collection at the specified index.

    void IList.RemoveAt (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the item to remove.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      Always thrown.

    Remarks

    You cannot change the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection class directly. To remove an item from the ListView+CheckedListViewItemCollection, use the Checked property.
